content.raw: To add to Carlos's point, it is worth noting that [protobuf specifically recommends not serializing anything much larger than 1MB](https://developers.google.com/protocol-buffers/docs/techniques#streaming). Single images from modern cameras can easily exceed 1MB in size and it would be very reasonable to have a single message with stereo data. I don't think flatbuffers will have this problem but that would need to be tested. That said, I would probably expect data to not simply be one huge flatbuffer and instead be broken into chunks where reasonable.
